docs.lead_paragraph: As a rapidly graying population sparks worries about a pension bust, an important figure in the property business pushes a controversial solution.

byline.contributor: Zhang Tiantian in Beijing contributed research.

docs.snippet: As a rapidly graying population sparks worries about a pension bust, an important figure in the property business pushes a controversial solution....
docs.abstract: Meng Xiaosu, businessman who laid groundwork for private homeownership in China, is urging elderly to take out reverse home mortgages as way to solve country's looming pension crisis; government think tank says by 2050 elderly will comprise nearly one-quarter of China's population and country's pension fund will be $116 trillion in red; reverse mortgage proposal has not been well received because it defies traditions.

headline.main: China’s ‘Godfather of Real Estate’ Pitches Reverse Mortgages to Skeptical Elders

docs.lead_paragraph: The contention that Americans chose Trump for his racist or sexist views is wrong; many voted for him despite that.
docs.snippet: The contention that Americans chose Trump for his racist or sexist views is wrong; many voted for him despite that....
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by political analyst David Paul Kuhn disputes notion that Donald J Trump won presidency by appealing to bigotry of voters; argues most of his supporters disapproved of him morally, yet voted for him anyway because he appeared to be only champion of economically struggling Americans.

headline.main: Sorry, Liberals. Bigotry Didn’t Elect Donald Trump.
